title: Major League Cricket returns to Oakland for weeklong series of matches at the Coliseum
body:
The sport of cricket is coming to the Oakland Coliseum in June.

Major League Cricket announced Wednesday that its season will kick off at the Coliseum on June 12 with the first of nine matches across seven days through June 18.

Major League Cricket is starting its third season in the U.S. and has six teams playing the sport, which is the second-largest in the world behind soccer but not as popular stateside as overseas.

The San Francisco Unicorns, one of three West Coast teams in the league along with ones in Los Angeles and Seattle, will be calling the Oakland Coliseum home. After the series of matches between June 12-18 that will include all six teams in the league, other matches during the season will be played in Texas and Florida.

Unicorns co-owner Venky Harinarayan said in a statement, “The passion for cricket in the Bay Area is undeniable, and we are thrilled to have a home that can accommodate and inspire our growing fanbase. We look forward to an incredible season ahead.”

Oakland City Councilmember Rebecca Kaplan’s office said the Coliseum will see changes to accommodate professional cricket matches, including the installation of specialized turf wickets.

The announcement comes after the Oakland Roots, a professional soccer team in the United Soccer League, held its home opener match last weekend at the Coliseum, which has seen the Oakland Raiders football team and Oakland Athletics baseball team both depart to other cities in recent years.

“Bringing more of this kind of activity to the Coliseum brings the community together, and also creates jobs, and improves revenue to fund vital public services,” Kaplan said in a statement. “Our region has the largest proportion of cricket fans in America, and the most passionate!”
summary:
* The third season of Major League Cricket in the US will kick off on June 12 at the Oakland Coliseum, with nine matches taking place over seven days until June 18.
* The tournament will feature all six teams in the league, including the San Francisco Unicorns, who will call the Oakland Coliseum their home.
* The Unicorns will play matches along with teams from Los Angeles and Seattle on the West Coast, with other matches being held in Texas and Florida later in the season.
* The Oakland Coliseum will undergo changes to accommodate professional cricket matches, including the installation of specialized turf wickets.
* The event is expected to bring the community together, create jobs, and generate revenue for public services, with the Bay Area having the largest proportion of cricket fans in America.

title: MLC 2025 Tickets Are Out NOW!
body:
Alright, buckle up cricket fans! The roar of the crowd, the crack of the bat, and the electric atmosphere of Major League Cricket (MLC) are all returning, and you can secure your place in the stands right now! Yes, you heard it right – Major League Cricket 2025 tickets are out NOW! This is after MLC already completed two successful seasons in the USA.

The anticipation has reached fever pitch, and the wait is finally over. The 2025 Cognizant Major League Cricket season is primed to deliver an unforgettable spectacle, and you can be a part of history. From the opening salvo at the iconic Oakland-Alameda Coliseum in California on Thursday, June 12th, to the MLC 2025 Championship Final in Grand Prairie, Texas, on July 13th, the journey promises thrills and spills daily.

Major League Cricket 2025 tickets

In a gesture of appreciation to the loyal fans who have fueled MLC’s rapid ascent over the last 2 years, an incredible Early Bird Discount is now live! For a limited time, you can snag your tickets and save up to a staggering 60%. This is your golden opportunity to witness world-class cricket without breaking the bank. Don’t let this slip through your fingers; these deals won’t last forever.

The MLC 2025 season is shaping up to be a watershed moment for cricket in North America. MLC is not just a tournament; it’s a movement, a catalyst for growth, and a bridge connecting global cricketing excellence with a burgeoning fanbase. You can watch international superstars live in action (Get Tickets Here) like Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, Glenn Maxwell, Faf Du Plessis, and others, who add to the entertainment of the league.

SEE ALSO: List of top online sports betting websites

Remember the nail-biting finishes from previous seasons? The inaugural MLC 2023 season, MI New York clinched the championship, and set a high bar for cricket in this region. MLC 2024 further solidified MLC’s position as a premier T20 league, with Washington Freedom emerging champs. Now, MLC 2025 promises to elevate the experience even further.

The action will move from the vibrant atmosphere of Oakland to the heart of Texas in Grand Prairie, and then to the sun-soaked fields of Broward, Florida. Each venue will host battles of epic proportions, as the six teams – Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, Washington Freedom, and San Francisco Unicorns.

MLC’s impact extends beyond the boundaries of the stadium. It’s fostering a culture of cricket, inspiring a new generation of players, and enriching the sporting landscape of the United States. The league is proving that cricket has a home in North America, and that home is growing stronger every year.

So, get ready to witness the magic unfold and experience the roar of the crowd with some of the world’s best cricketers in action. Secure your MLC 2025 tickets now and be part of the excitement. This is more than just a game; it’s a celebration of cricket, a testament to its global appeal, and a glimpse into its bright future in North America.

For similar cricketing news and updates from around the world, remember to always stay tuned to ReadScoops.com.

title: Early Bird Tickets On Sale for Cognizant Major League Cricket 2025 Season
body:
Early bird matchday tickets and season passes for the 2025 Cognizant Major League Cricket season are now available to purchase online via the MLC official ticketing platform.

San Francisco Unicorns to play in front of their home fans for the first time, with the first phase of the league stage to be played at the Oakland Coliseum, CA.

Following the release of the Cognizant Major League Cricket schedule last week and a successful presale round, San Francisco Unicorns fans can begin to officially plan out their attendance for the upcoming season, with single match tickets and Oakland–Alameda County Coliseum season passes now available to purchase, at early bird prices, through the official ticketing platform on the official MLC website.

The 2025 MLC season kicks off on June 12 and will be played across three stadiums. For the first time, league games will be held at the Oakland Coliseum and Broward County Stadium near Fort Lauderdale, Florida. Grand Prairie Stadium near Dallas, Texas, will also host league games and serve as the venue for the playoff series.

San Francisco Unicorns play host to Washington Freedom in the first match of this year’s tournament, marking a repeat of the 2024 final, as well as the landmark homecoming of the Unicorns as they play in the Bay Area for the first time at the Oakland Coliseum.

Fans looking to witness history and watch the Unicorns at home for the first time can do so by purchasing tickets, priced from $20 upwards, for the match against the Washington Freedom on Thursday June 12, the LA Knight Riders on Saturday June 14, and MI New York on Sunday June 15, before the MLC show goes on the road for the rest of the league phase to Grand Prairie and then Fort Lauderdale.

The full San Francisco Unicorns league stage schedule is as follows:

Thursday, June 12 vs. Washington Freedom (Oakland, CA)

Saturday, June 14 vs. LA Knight Riders (Oakland, CA)

Sunday, June 15 vs. MI New York (Oakland, CA)

Friday, June 20 vs. Texas Super Kings (Grand Prairie, TX)

Monday, June 23 vs. MI New York (Grand Prairie, TX)

Wednesday, June 25 vs. Seattle Orcas (Grand Prairie, TX)

Saturday, June 28 vs. Washington Freedom (Grand Prairie, TX)

Tuesday, July 1 vs. Seattle Orcas (Fort Lauderdale, FL)

Friday, July 4 vs. Texas Super Kings (Fort Lauderdale, FL)

Sunday, July 6 vs. LA Knight Riders (Fort Lauderdale, FL)

David White, San Francisco Unicorns CEO, commented on the ticket release, “With major interest in the presale round, we encourage all our fans and the wider US cricketing community, as well as their friends and family, to quickly snap up their seats at early bird prices for what will be a series of landmark homecoming games for the Unicorns in the Bay Area.

“With an exciting squad eager to play in a home fortress, we want to get this year’s MLC off to the best possible start with early success at the Oakland Coliseum, which is set to be the ideal venue for some explosive entertainment showcasing the best of US and global cricket talent.”

title: Manager, Digital & Social Media - Major League Cricket
body:
Organisations

Digital Media

Social Media

Cricket

7 days ago USA

Application Deadline - 19th Apr 2025 @ 12:00 am (BST)

Reporting to the VP, Marketing, the Manager, Digital and Social Media will play a key role in the success of the 2025 Major League Cricket season by managing MLC’s presence across social and digital platforms. This role will develop digital and social content strategies that grow and engage Major League Cricket’s audience, and support the broader marketing team in delivering a world class fan experience.

Key Responsibility Areas:

Manage and grow Major League Cricket accounts on Facebook, Instagram, X, Threads, WhatsApp & YouTube.

Lead on content creation and publishing for Major League Cricket’s official social platforms.

Build and maintain a social media content calendar.

Track social performance and trends using analytics tools.

Curate and manage a list of influential voices for social collaborations.

Ensure the website is up-to-date with key information.

Manage newsletter creation and distribution.

title: The Oakland Coliseum in California to Host Nine 2025 MLC Games
body:
The San Francisco Unicorns will host its 2025 Major League Cricket (MLC) home matches at the historic Oakland Coliseum, bringing world-class cricket to the Bay Area for the first time.

This move, which will see all three of the Unicorns’ regular-season home games played at the iconic stadium, marks a significant step for the franchise and Major League Cricket – not just in bringing another founding team to its home market, but enabling a previously unheralded connection with the local fanbase.

“We are beyond thrilled to bring the San Francisco Unicorns to the Oakland Coliseum for our home matches in 2025,” said David White, CEO of the San Francisco Unicorns. “The Bay Area has a deep and growing love for cricket and this move allows us to create an unforgettable matchday experience in one of the region’s most iconic venues.

“We can’t wait to welcome fans from across the Bay Area to cheer on the Unicorns in our new home.”

A total of nine matches will be hosted at the Coliseum, featuring all of MLC’s six teams. The Unicorns will host its opening game at the Oakland Coliseum against the Washington Freedom on June 12 – a rematch of the 2024 Championship game. On June 12, Shane Watson’s side will welcome West Coast rivals LA Knight Riders, before hosting MI New York on Father’s Day, June 15.

The decision to host MLC matches in Oakland has been met with enthusiasm from local officials. “The Oakland Coliseum has long been a destination for sports and entertainment, and we are excited to add cricket to its continuing legacy,” said City of Oakland Interim Mayor Kevin Jenkins. “This move underscores Oakland’s status as a diverse and dynamic sports city, and we look forward to supporting the growth of cricket in our community.”

Johnny Grave, CEO of Major League Cricket, also expressed his excitement about the league’s new venue. “The Coliseum is a fantastic location for Major League Cricket, and we are thrilled by the prospect of some of the world’s biggest cricket stars playing in such an iconic Californian venue.”

“Coming to the West Coast, and being here in Oakland, is an historic move for cricket globally. It reinforces our commitment to growing the game in the United States and providing fans with an exceptional cricket experience.”

San Francisco Unicorns co-owners Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan also commented on bringing Major League Cricket to the Bay Area: “The arrival of this sport at a world-class venue like the Oakland Coliseum, and the opportunity to have the Unicorns play in its home market, is a dream come true for us,” said Rajaraman. “We are fully committed to making the Unicorns a key part of the Bay Area’s sporting culture and providing fans with an exciting and memorable cricket experience.”

Nicole Strange, General Manager, Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum and Oakland Arena (ASM Global) added: “We are proud to welcome Major League Cricket to the Coliseum in June. This will be an incredible opportunity for the Bay Area community and beyond to experience this global sport right here in the heart of Oakland.”

In addition to playing at the Oakland Coliseum, the 2025 season will take place at Major League Cricket’s flagship venue, Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, TX, and Broward County Stadium in Lauderhill, FL. Fans can sign up for access to pre-sale tickets on the Major League Cricket website: majorleaguecricket.com.
summary:
**Summary:**

The San Francisco Unicorns, a founding team of Major League Cricket (MLC), will host its 2025 home matches at the Oakland Coliseum, bringing world-class cricket to the Bay Area for the first time. The Unicorns will play three regular-season home games at the iconic stadium, including an opening match against the Washington Freedom on June 12, a rematch of the 2024 Championship game. A total of nine MLC matches will be held at the Coliseum, featuring all six MLC teams. The 2025 season will also take place at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Broward County Stadium in Florida. Fans can sign up for pre-sale tickets on the MLC website.

title: Zimbabwe’s Sikandar Raza Joins Seattle Orcas for Major League Cricket Season 3
body:
Seattle Orcas have secured the services of Zimbabwean all-rounder Sikandar Raza for Major League Cricket (MLC) Season 3, adding a wealth of experience and match-winning ability to our squad.

Raza has been a standout performer in T20 leagues worldwide, boasting an impressive record across 279 matches, amassing 5,647 runs with his explosive batting, and claiming 169 wickets with his effective off-spin.

The 38-year-old veteran is no stranger to success, having played a key role in multiple championship-winning campaigns. He lifted the Caribbean Premier League title with Trinbago Knight Riders in 2020, was part of Lahore Qalandars' victorious PSL squad in 2023, and most recently, helped Dubai Capitals clinch their maiden ILT20 title in 2025, finishing the tournament in style with a blistering 34* off 12 balls in the final.

With championship pedigree and a reputation for delivering under pressure, Raza brings a winning mentality to the Seattle Orcas as we gear up for the upcoming MLC season.

Welcome to the Podsquad, Sikandar Raza!
summary:
* The Seattle Orcas have signed Zimbabwean all-rounder Sikandar Raza for MLC Season 3.
* Raza brings a wealth of experience and match-winning ability to the squad, with an impressive record in T20 leagues worldwide.
* The article does not provide specific details about the MLC Season 3, such as its schedule or participating teams, but implies that the Seattle Orcas are preparing for the upcoming season.
